questions.question: The event has been ………………………… until next week.
questions.description: To put off is to postpone.

questions.question: Please ………………………….. your coat. I am taking you to the doctor.
questions.description: To put on is to wear

questions.question: ………………………… the toys once you have finished playing with them.
questions.description: To put away is to store for future use.

questions.question: They …………………………….. the fire in the basement of the building.
questions.description: To put out is to extinguish.

questions.question: We are planning to ……………………………. a fence around the property.
questions.description: To put up is to erect.

questions.question: She ……………………………. a lot of effort to succeed in her business.
questions.description: To put in is to invest.

questions.question: I can no longer ……………………………….. his insolence.
questions.description: To put up with something is to tolerate it.

questions.question: I ……………………………. the whole neighborhood but nobody had seen my cat.
questions.description: To ask around is to ask the same question to a lot of people.

questions.question: We had a small …………………………… yesterday.
questions.description: To get together is to meet.

questions.question: The noise …………………………….. after some time.
questions.description: When noise dies down, it becomes weaker.

questions.question: The scheme ............................... for want of support.
questions.description: When something falls through, it fails.

questions.question: Suddenly the wheel .................................... the bicycle.
questions.description: To come off is to become detached.
